me.bhop.bjdautilities.command.response

Interface CommandResponses

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultCommandResponses

    public interface CommandResponses
    A template for included command responses. This can be implemented to create custom responses for included messages.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message invalidArguments(net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message message, java.util.List<java.lang.String> args)
      Sent when a user attempts to execute a command given invalid or improper arguments.
      net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message noPerms(net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message message, java.util.List<net.dv8tion.jda.api.Permission> permission)
      Sent when a user attempts to execute a command which they do not have permission for.
      net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message notEnoughArguments(net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message message, int required, java.util.List<java.lang.String> args)
      Sent when a user attempts to execute a command without supplying enough arguments
      net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message unknownCommand(net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message message, java.lang.String prefix)
      Sent when a user attempts to execute an unknown command.
      net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message unknownError(net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message message)
      Sent when a command encounters an unknown issue.

      This is the default usage for a command.

      • unknownCommand

        net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message unknownCommand(net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message message,
                                                     java.lang.String prefix)
        Sent when a user attempts to execute an unknown command.
        Parameters:
        message - the sender's original message
        prefix - the CommandHandler prefix
        Returns:
        the compiled response

        net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message noPerms(net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message message,
                                              java.util.List<net.dv8tion.jda.api.Permission> permission)
        Sent when a user attempts to execute a command which they do not have permission for.
        Parameters:
        message - the sender's original message
        permission - the permissions which they may be lacking
        Returns:
        the compiled response

      • invalidArguments

        net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message invalidArguments(net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message message,
                                                       java.util.List<java.lang.String> args)
        Sent when a user attempts to execute a command given invalid or improper arguments.
        Parameters:
        message - the sender's original message
        args - the arguments which were supplied to the command
        Returns:
        the compiled response

      • usage

        net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message usage(net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message message,
                                            java.util.List<java.lang.String> args,
                                            java.lang.String usage)
        This is the default usage for a command. This is sent when a user executes a command incorrectly and the usage has not been overridden in the command itself.
        Parameters:
        message - the sender's original message
        args - the arguments which were supplied to the command
        usage - the usage of the command
        Returns:
        the compiled response

      • notEnoughArguments

        net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message notEnoughArguments(net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message message,
                                                         int required,
                                                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> args)
        Sent when a user attempts to execute a command without supplying enough arguments
        Parameters:
        message - the sender's original message
        required - the number of arguments required for the command
        args - the arguments which were supplied to the command
        Returns:
        the compiled response

        Sent when a command encounters an unknown issue.
        Parameters:
        message - the sender's original message
        Returns:
        the compiled response
